column4: what backup solution would be easiest to use for disaster recovery in Ubuntu? I mean easiest when it is time for recovery not necessarily easiest to set up or use.
I'm looking for something that a user could easily recover from a major league screwed up system with little or no help from a tech or help line. Something similar to ghost.
tonyarusso  I could supply either a second drive or network storage area.
I used 'tar' to back up the home directory of the oneandonly user on my kids machine back when they were smaller. Pressing alt-uparrow automatically restored it.
